tool.name: FPStep2
tool.description: Predict the copy number of gene families present in the predicted genome for each study sequence.

param.name: input_tree
param.label: Tree file
param.help: The full reference tree in newick format containing both study sequences (i.e. ASVs or OTUs) and reference sequences (FPStep1 output tree).

validator.message: A built-in database is not available

param.name: function
param.label: Function table
param.help: 16S : 'EC' or/and 'KO' should be at least chosen ( EC for Metacyc pathway analysis or/and KO for Kegg pathway analysis. Others values are optionnal. ITS and 18S : 'EC' only available.

validator.message: 'EC' is the default database used by Picrust2. 'EC' or 'KO' must be at least selected. Other tables are optionnal

param.name: hsp_method
param.label: HSP method
param.help: HSP method to use."mp": predict discrete traits usingmax parsimony. "emp_prob": predict discrete traits based on empirical state probabilities across tips. "subtree_average": predict continuous traits using subtree averaging. "pic": predict continuous traits with phylogentic independent contrast. "scp": reconstruct continuous traits using squared-change parsimony (default: mp).

tool.help:
@HELP_LOGO@
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Prediction of functional abundances based solely on the sequences of marker genes with `PICRUSt2 <https://github.com/picrust/picrust2>`_. The available marker genes are 16S, ITS and 18S.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Context
The second step of Picrust2 consists to run hidden-state prediction (hsp) to predict gene family abundances with `castor-R <https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/castor/index.html>`_ of each OTUs constructed elsewhere in a reference phylogenetic tree (FPStep1).
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Inputs
**Tree file** (format newick `nxh <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newick_format>`_):
The phylogenetic tree of insert sequences (FPStep 1 output : FPStep1_tree.nwk)
**OTUs biom file**:
The OTUs biom file from FPStep1 (format `biom1 <http://biom-format.org/documentation/format_versions/biom-1.0.html>`_). (FPStep1.biom)
**Function table**:
If the genetic marker studied is 16S RNA gene: Which default pre-calculated count table to use. For 16S rRNA gene you can choose between: 'EC', 'KO', 'COG', 'PFAM', 'TIGRFAM', and/or 'PHENO'.
For further processes by other FROGS Picrust2 tools that requiring Metacyc and Kegg databases, you must select at least 'EC' or 'KO'.
For ITS and 18S markers, 'EC' is only available.
For more informations about the different databases:
- EC : https://enzyme.expasy.org/
- COG : https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/research/cog-project/
- KO : https://www.genome.jp/kegg/ko.html
- PFAM : http://pfam.xfam.org/
- TIGRFAM : https://tigrfams.jcvi.org/cgi-bin/index.cgi
.. class:: h3
Outputs
**Output marker file**:
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_FPStep2_marker.png
Output table of predicted marker gene copy numbers per study sequence in input tree. (FPStep2_marker_nsti_predicted.tsv)
Marker gene copies number prediction is used to normalize the counting matrices of the gene families. For example, if the OTU have 2 16S copies, the number of gene families in the function file for this OTU will be divided by 2.
**Output function file**:
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_FPStep2_function.png
Output table with predicted abundances per study sequence in input tree. (FPStep2_predicted_functions.tsv)
**Summary file**:
.. image:: static/images/FROGS_FPStep2_nsti.png
Nearest Sequenced Taxon Index (NSTI) is the phylogenetic distance between the OTU and the nearest sequenced reference genome. This metric can be used to identify OTUs that are highly distant from all reference sequences (the predictions for these sequences are less reliable!). The higher the NSTI score, the less the affiliations are relevant. Any OTUs with a NSTI value higher than 2 are typically either from uncharacterized phyla or off-target sequences.
The graph shows the number of deleted OTUs and sequences according to the NSTI threshold. It's a decision support tool to help choosing the NSTI threshold during FPStep3. A good practice is to choose a threshold that keeps a good number of sequences while ensuring that the taxonomies between FROGS and Picrust2 of these sequences do not diverge too much.
